author: bridge-bot
content:
<yashasvi_yc7> Hey 7560 team, @yoavw @drortirosh @forshtat 
I was catching up on the latest changes on 7560 and saw a lot of stuff that has been moved to new and smaller RIPs. 
One thing I am unable to find are RPC methods that were previously defined but deleted in this PR: https://github.com/ethereum/RIPs/pull/21
Are they added in a different RIP?

author: bridge-bot
content:
<forshtat> Hello @yashasvi_yc7, right, we have removed them from the RIP and have not yet created a new one with a full specification for the RPC calls. There is also a number of smart-accounts related ERCs being created right now. (re @yashasvi_yc7: Hey 7560 team, @yoavw @drortirosh @forshtat 
I was catching up on the latest changes on 7560 and saw a lot of stuff that has been moved to new and smaller RIPs. 
One thing I am unable to find are RPC methods that were previously defined but deleted in this PR: https://github.com/ethereum/RIPs/pull/21
Are they added in a different RIP?)

author: bridge-bot
content:
<yashasvi_yc7> I see, thanks Alex! 
I assume the RPCs would more or less remain the same as what was initially in the spec, or will there be any major changes? 

Also, what are these smart accounts ERCs? Is there a PR or Ethereum Magician thread for these? (re @forshtat: Hello @yashasvi_yc7, right, we have removed them from the RIP and have not yet created a new one with a full specification for the RPC calls. There is also a number of smart-accounts related ERCs being created right now.)

author: bridge-bot
content:
<forshtat> I remember these two for sure:
ERC-5792: Wallet Call API
ERC-7677: Paymaster Web Service Capability

There are probably others, people in this group should know more. 

Re: major changes, I think not. But it seems like there is also a demand for some RPCs not to be set in stone as part of the protocol, but instead to be more agile. We will need to try to balance that with a need for a standardized RPC API. (re @yashasvi_yc7: I see, thanks Alex! 
I assume the RPCs would more or less remain the same as what was initially in the spec, or will there be any major changes? 

Also, what are these smart accounts ERCs? Is there a PR or Ethereum Magician thread for these?)
